com.microsoft.azure.sdk.iot.device.transport.https

Class HttpsIotHubConnection

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.microsoft.azure.sdk.iot.device.transport.https.HttpsIotHubConnection

  • public class HttpsIotHubConnection
extends java.lang.Object
    An HTTPS connection between a device and an IoT Hub. Contains functionality for synchronously connecting to the different IoT Hub resource URIs.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      HttpsIotHubConnection(DeviceClientConfig config)
      Constructs an instance from the given DeviceClientConfig object.

    • Method Detail

      • sendEvent

        public ResponseMessage sendEvent(HttpsMessage msg)
                          throws java.io.IOException
        Sends an event message.
        Parameters:
        msg - the event message.
        Returns:
        the ResponseMessage including status code and payload from sending the event message.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if the IoT Hub could not be reached.

      • sendHttpsMessage

        public ResponseMessage sendHttpsMessage(HttpsMessage httpsMessage,
                                        HttpsMethod httpsMethod,
                                        java.lang.String httpsPath)
                                 throws java.io.IOException
        Sends an generic https message.
        Parameters:
        httpsMessage - the message to send.
        httpsMethod - the https method (GET, POST, PUT, DELETE).
        httpsPath - the path that will be added at the end of the URI with `/`.
        Returns:
        the ResponseMessage including status code and payload from sending message.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if the IoT Hub could not be reached.

      • receiveMessage

        public Message receiveMessage()
                       throws java.io.IOException
        Receives a message, if one exists.
        Returns:
        a message, or null if none exists.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if the IoT Hub could not be reached.

      • sendMessageResult

        public void sendMessageResult(IotHubMessageResult result)
                       throws java.io.IOException,
                              java.lang.SecurityException
        Sends the message result for the previously received message.
        Parameters:
        result - the message result (one of IotHubMessageResult.COMPLETE, IotHubMessageResult.ABANDON, or IotHubMessageResult.REJECT).
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if sendMessageResult is called before receiveMessage() is called.
        java.io.IOException - if the IoT Hub could not be reached.
        java.lang.SecurityException - if the sas token saved in config has expired and cannot be renewed
